methodology_note: Scores use 50 as a baseline (average risk), adjusted based on fresh evidence and structural signals as of the date above.

evidence_bullets: Zero-day options now account for roughly half of S&P 500 option volume (vs ~5% in 2016) [oai_citation:113‡bis.org](https://www.bis.org/publ/qtrpdf/r_qt2403x.htm?ref=investo.global#:~:text=relatively%20cheap%20and%20provide%20a,but%20on%20rare%20occasions%20generates), driven by retail and algo trading

evidence_bullets: CDC reports H5 bird flu is pervasive in wild birds and even seen in U.S. dairy cattle, with **several human cases** in exposed workers [oai_citation:115‡cdc.gov](https://www.cdc.gov/bird-flu/situation-summary/index.html#:~:text=,bird%20flu%20activity%20in%20people)

clusters.name: China Property & Local Debt
tripwires_breached: IMF warns LGFV hidden debt ~¥58T is unsustainable
evidence_bullets: Evergrande’s collapse in 2021-22 triggered a broader **real estate credit crisis** – over 50 Chinese developers have defaulted on debts since then [oai_citation:118‡yipinstitute.org](https://yipinstitute.org/policy/economic-implications-of-evergrande-collapse#:~:text=Evergrande%E2%80%99s%20default%20represents%20a%20turning,revenue%20as%20land%20sales%20decline), and property sales/home prices continue to decline in 2024-25.

IMF (FSAP 2025) flagged **¥58 trillion** in local government financing vehicle (LGFV) debt as “a serious risk to financial stability” [oai_citation:119‡atlanticcouncil.org](https://www.atlanticcouncil.org/blogs/econographics/sinographs/beijing-extends-and-pretends-to-deal-with-its-mountain-of-local-government-debt/#:~:text=The%20International%20Monetary%20Fund%20,on%20directly%20by%20local%20governments). Despite Beijing’s refinancing of ¥10T in 2024, most local debt remains and is straining provincial finances.

events_update.title: Office Crash Triggers Record CRE Loan Defaults
tripwires: Major landlords defaulting on office mortgages
CMBS delinquency >10% (breached)
Office valuations -40% from peak
rationale: Office property values have plunged due to remote work, pushing **office CMBS delinquency to 11.7%** (all-time high) [oai_citation:120‡trepp.com](https://www.trepp.com/trepptalk/cmbs-delinquency-rate-increases-again-in-august-2025#:~:text=Breaking%20it%20down%20by%20property,time%20high%20of%2011.66). Brookfield and other big owners have defaulted on trophy assets, illustrating the stress [oai_citation:121‡commercialobserver.com](https://commercialobserver.com/2025/08/brookfield-dmv-office-distress/#:~:text=A%20Brookfield%20investment%20fund%2C%20Brookfield,balance%20of%20about%20%24161%20million). This event is elevated as defaults are rising and credit markets are tightening for CRE, with knock-on risk to banks.

events_update.title: Regional Banks Face CRE Maturity Wall
tripwires: CRE loan delinquencies rising at multiple regional banks
>$100B in CRE loans extended or restructured
rationale: About $2 trillion in commercial real estate debt comes due by end-2025, and **regional/small banks hold ~70%** of those loans [oai_citation:122‡scotsmanguide.com](https://www.scotsmanguide.com/commercial/more-pain-to-come-for-regional-banks/#:~:text=Here%20is%20one%20more%20statistic%3A,existential%20threat%20for%20some%20landlords). As interest rates have jumped, many borrowers will struggle to refinance. Banks have started increasing loan-loss reserves. Officials (e.g. Yellen) foresee stress at smaller banks from CRE, though they expect it to be contained [oai_citation:123‡reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/business/yellen-concerned-about-us-commercial-real-estate-says-stresses-manageable-2024-02-06/#:~:text=Yellen%20told%20a%20House%20Financial,the%20owners%20of%20these%20properties). We keep this at watch: credit is tightening, but an outright banking crisis hasn’t materialized beyond isolated cases.

events_update.title: France Downgrade as Yields Converge with Italy
tripwires: France political crisis over budget (breached Sept 2025)
Italy return to 4%+ yields
rationale: For the first time, France is trading at par with Italy in borrowing costs [oai_citation:124‡reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/why-france-italys-10-year-borrowing-costs-match-first-time-2025-09-18/#:~:text=Italian%20and%20French%2010,according%20to%20LSEG%20data). This reflects France’s fiscal credibility deteriorating – high deficits and political gridlock led Fitch to cut France’s rating [oai_citation:125‡reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/why-france-italys-10-year-borrowing-costs-match-first-time-2025-09-18/#:~:text=Fitch%20ratings%20cut%20France%27s%20rating,in%20less%20than%20two%20years). Meanwhile, Italy’s near-term risk eased as it maintained fiscal targets (and even got a rating outlook boost). The event is in watch phase: markets are alert but not panicked; a lot rides on France passing credible budget reforms and Italy sustaining progress.

events_update.title: AI Data Center Boom Tests Grid Limits
tripwires: Emergency grid alerts due to data center load (observed in 2025)
Delayed or canceled data center projects for lack of power
rationale: Grid regulators are explicitly warning that the rapid proliferation of energy-hungry AI data centers is outpacing the electric supply build-out [oai_citation:126‡news.bgov.com](https://news.bgov.com/tech-and-telecom-law/data-centers-pose-threat-to-electric-grids-says-us-regulator?context=search&index=0#:~:text=Big%20data%20centers%20connecting%20to,charged%20with%20overseeing%20the%20sector). NERC’s 2025 report calls it a major near-term reliability challenge [oai_citation:127‡electric.coop](https://www.electric.coop/rapid-data-center-development-challenges-grid-reliability-nerc-report-says#:~:text=Huge%2C%20electricity,North%20American%20Electric%20Reliability%20Corp). This event is elevated: we have concrete evidence of strain (e.g. tighter reserve margins, localized load curtailments). However, no widespread blackouts have been attributed to AI loads yet, keeping it below critical.

events_update.title: Global Freight Indices Slump on Weak Demand
tripwires: Container rates falling to 2020 lows (partially seen early 2025)
Idle container ship fleet > 15%
rationale: Through early 2025, multiple freight benchmarks (container and bulk) fell significantly [oai_citation:128‡unctad.org](https://unctad.org/publication/global-trade-update-march-2025#:~:text=,dependent%20sectors), mirroring a manufacturing slowdown. This raised recessionary flags. Mid-year data showed some stabilization [oai_citation:129‡unctad.org](https://unctad.org/news/global-trade-grew-300-billion-first-half-2025-led-us-imports-and-eu-exports#:~:text=Still%2C%20signs%20of%20resilience%20remain,may%20continue%20its%20robust%20growth). We keep this event at watch: global trade hasn’t collapsed, but if freight rates slide further or stay depressed, it may signal broader economic stress.

events_update.title: Panama Canal Drought Restricts Shipping Traffic
tripwires: Transit backlog >100 ships (as in 2023, and again mid-2025)
Extended periods of draft <44 ft imposed (breached in 2023 & 2025)
rationale: The Panama Canal has been forced to impose draft and transit limits due to insufficient rainfall [oai_citation:130‡supplychains.com](https://supplychains.com/navigating-drought-panama-canal-imposes-restrictions-on-large-ships/#:~:text=The%20Depth%20Dilemma). In mid-2025, ships over 13.3m draft could not pass, and daily slot quotas were reduced. This event is elevated because it directly disrupts global supply chains (some shippers have had to reroute or load less cargo). With climate volatility, the canal’s reliability is in question, making this a recurring systemic risk.

events_update.title: 0DTE Options Boom Amplifies Crash Risk Fears
tripwires: Large intraday SPX swing (>5%) coinciding with 0DTE volume surge
Market liquidity drying up on non-event day
rationale: Zero-day options trading has soared, and while it hasn’t caused a known incident, experts continue to caution that these derivatives could **exacerbate a sudden sell-off** [oai_citation:131‡reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/0dte-options-trading-could-exacerbate-stock-market-volatility-2023-03-17/#:~:text=In%20a%20report%20published%20earlier,market%20drop). The event remains in watch: volumes are high and growing [oai_citation:132‡bis.org](https://www.bis.org/publ/qtrpdf/r_qt2403x.htm?ref=investo.global#:~:text=relatively%20cheap%20and%20provide%20a,but%20on%20rare%20occasions%20generates), but markets have been orderly so far. Any flash-crash-like event would move this to critical instantly.

events_update.title: H5N1 Bird Flu Spreads in Mammals, Sporadic Human Cases
tripwires: Evidence of limited human-to-human transmission
Significant H5N1 genome change (e.g. human receptor binding adaptation)
rationale: The H5N1 avian flu epizootic remains widespread, and the virus is infecting an unprecedented range of mammals (e.g. US cat infections across 19 states in 2025) [oai_citation:133‡woah.org](https://www.woah.org/app/uploads/2025/07/25728-fao-woah-who-h5-assessment.pdf#:~:text=the%20continued%20transmission%20of%20A,in%20other%20mammals%20continued%20to). Human infections have occurred (two dozen+ cases in 2023-2025 globally), but all linked to poultry exposure and no sustained human spread [oai_citation:134‡woah.org](https://www.woah.org/app/uploads/2025/07/25728-fao-woah-who-h5-assessment.pdf#:~:text=Since%20the%20last%20joint%20assessment,direct%20or%20indirect%20exposure%20to). This event is in watch phase: the risk to humans could change rapidly if the virus adapts, but for now it’s mainly a veterinary issue with pandemic potential. Authorities are on high alert – any cluster of unexplained human cases would escalate this risk immediately.

events_update.title: China Property Crisis Deepens with Developer Defaults
tripwires: Major developer liquidation (Evergrande ordered to wind up – *breached*)
Property investment -20% YoY sustained
rationale: China’s once-booming real estate sector remains in a severe downturn. Evergrande’s default and pending liquidation was just the first domino – **over 50 developers have defaulted** on debt since 2021 [oai_citation:135‡yipinstitute.org](https://yipinstitute.org/policy/economic-implications-of-evergrande-collapse#:~:text=Evergrande%E2%80%99s%20default%20represents%20a%20turning,revenue%20as%20land%20sales%20decline). Home sales and prices continue to fall (2024 new home sales -14% YoY [oai_citation:136‡globalpropertyguide.com](https://www.globalpropertyguide.com/asia/china/price-history#:~:text=China%27s%20Residential%20Property%20Market%20Analysis,year%2C%20compared%20to%20sharper)), undermining local government revenues and consumer confidence. This event is elevated: the property slump is ongoing and posing credit risks, but it hasn’t yet precipitated a broader financial crisis (thanks in part to government control and gradual workout efforts).

events_update.title: China’s Hidden Local Debt Threatens Financial Stability
tripwires: Local government defaults or bailouts (e.g. a LGFV bond default beyond grace period)
Central gov’t announces rescue fund for provincial debts
rationale: China’s local governments face a **debt time bomb** after years of off-budget borrowing. An IMF assessment in 2025 warned that ~¥58 trillion in local government financing vehicle debt is *“a serious risk to financial stability”* [oai_citation:137‡atlanticcouncil.org](https://www.atlanticcouncil.org/blogs/econographics/sinographs/beijing-extends-and-pretends-to-deal-with-its-mountain-of-local-government-debt/#:~:text=The%20International%20Monetary%20Fund%20,on%20directly%20by%20local%20governments). Many provinces are rolling over loans and cutting spending to avoid default. Beijing has so far opted to “extend and pretend” (refinancing a portion of hidden debt) [oai_citation:138‡atlanticcouncil.org](https://www.atlanticcouncil.org/blogs/econographics/sinographs/beijing-extends-and-pretends-to-deal-with-its-mountain-of-local-government-debt/#:~:text=because%20the%20Chinese%20government%20already,other%20obligations%20that%20remain%20unaddressed). This event is elevated: the strain is evident and could culminate in either a financial crisis or a large central government intervention. However, given China’s closed financial system, we have not yet seen an acute trigger moment – it’s a growing pressure that warrants close monitoring.
